title: Linear Regression
why: The Linear Regression exam introduces fundamental machine learning concepts through 15 practical questions, covering the algorithm's core components (slope, intercept), optimization techniques (gradient descent, cost functions), and real-world applications (price prediction) - providing beginners with a solid foundation in this essential predictive modeling technique while emphasizing practical implementation over theoretical complexity.

questions.question: What is the primary goal of linear regression?
Which of the following represents the equation of a simple linear regression model?
In the linear regression equation y = mx + b, what does 'm' represent?
True or False: Linear regression assumes a linear relationship between input and output variables.
What is the purpose of the cost function in linear regression?
options: To measure the error between predicted and actual values
To reduce the number of features
questions.correctAnswer: To measure the error between predicted and actual values

questions.question: Which of the following is a common cost function for linear regression?
What does gradient descent do in linear regression?
True or False: Gradient descent updates model parameters iteratively.
In gradient descent, what is the role of the learning rate?
options: It controls the step size of parameter updates
It defines the number of features
questions.correctAnswer: It controls the step size of parameter updates

questions.question: What happens if the learning rate in gradient descent is too large?
options: The model may fail to converge
questions.correctAnswer: The model may fail to converge

questions.question: True or False: The cost function is always a positive value.
Scenario: You need to predict house prices based on square footage. Which algorithm should you use?
Which component of linear regression adjusts the model to fit the data?
What does the 'b' in the linear regression equation y = mx + b represent?
